bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in
        Council.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Sale and Purchase of Regulated Metal

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person must not sell regulated metal to a metal dealer or recycler unless, at
          the time of the transaction, the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
presents prescribed identification to the metal dealer or recycler,
            and
provides the metal dealer or recycler with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the information referred to in section 5 (2) (a), (c), (d) and (e),
              and
any other prescribed information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A metal dealer or recycler must not purchase regulated metal from a person
            unless, at the time of the transaction, the person complies with the requirements of
              section
              2.

A metal dealer or recycler must, at the time of the transaction, take reasonable
            measures to ensure that the identification presented in accordance with section 2
            (a)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
has not been altered or defaced to misrepresent the age or identity of the
              person,
was issued by the issuing agency to the person, and
is not otherwise forged or fraudulently made.

bcl:text: A metal dealer or recycler must not purchase

unless the person selling the metallic wire or regulated metal provides proof of
            ownership of the property.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
metallic wire that reasonably appears to have had insulation or casing removed
              from it, or

regulated metal that bears distinguishing or identifying marks indicating
              ownership of the metal by any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a local authority;

a public utility or similar entity that distributes, through piping or
                wiring, electricity, telephone services or cable television signals;
a prescribed entity,

bcl:section.bcl:text:
If a metal dealer or recycler or any of its employees has reasonable grounds to
          believe that regulated metal in the possession of the metal dealer or recycler is stolen
          property, the metal dealer or recycler or the employee, as applicable, must immediately
          inform the local police authority of the fact.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A metal dealer or recycler must not purchase regulated metal unless, at the time
            of the transaction, the metal dealer or recycler

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assigns a customer code to the transaction, and
records the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
a description of the regulated metal, including its type, weight and any
                distinguishing marks or features;
the date and time of the transaction;
the total value of the transaction;

the full name of the individual who conducts the transaction on behalf of the
              metal dealer or recycler;
the customer code assigned under paragraph (a);
any other prescribed information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In addition to the requirements of subsection (1), a metal dealer or
            recycler must not purchase regulated metal unless, at the time of the transaction, the
            metal dealer or recycler collects and records the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the full name, current address and telephone number of the person selling the
              metal;

a description, including any prescribed information, of the identification
              presented in accordance with section 2 (a);

the origin of the regulated metal as stated by the person selling the
              metal;

if the individual who delivers the regulated metal to the business premises of
              the metal dealer or recycler is not the owner of the metal at the time of the
              transaction, the full name, current address and telephone number of the individual who
              delivers the metal;

if a motor vehicle is used to deliver the regulated metal to the business
              premises of the metal dealer or recycler, the following information in respect of the
              motor vehicle:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paint colour, make and model;
licence plate number and province of issue;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other prescribed information.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A metal dealer or recycler must, for each transaction, provide the information
          referred to in section 5 (1) (b) to the local police authority within the prescribed period
          of time and in the prescribed manner and form.
A metal dealer or recycler must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
record and maintain transaction information in the prescribed manner and form,
            and

keep transaction information on the metal dealer or recycler's business premises
            for at least one year from the date of the transaction.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person must not carry on business as a metal dealer or recycler unless the
          person is registered under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person may apply to the registrar for registration under this Act or for
            renewal of registration.
An application for registration or renewal of registration must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made in the form and manner required by the registrar, and
be accompanied by the prescribed fee, if any.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who applies for registration or renewal of registration must meet all
            the conditions and requirements imposed under this Act.

The registrar may, on application under section 9, grant registration or
            renewal of registration for a period not exceeding the prescribed period.
The registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
impose on a registration any terms and conditions that the registrar considers
              appropriate, and
amend or remove a term or condition of a registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar must provide the applicant or registrant written reasons for a
            decision under subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are terms and conditions of every registration:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a registrant must report to the registrar, within 10 days of its
            occurrence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a change in the registrant's business address, and
a change in any prescribed information;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a registrant must comply

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: with this Act and the regulations, and
with the terms and conditions of the registrant's registration;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other prescribed terms and conditions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refusal, suspension or termination of registration

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar may refuse to grant registration or renewal of registration if any
            of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the applicant or registrant fails in any way to comply with, or does not meet
              the requirements of, section 9;

the application is for renewal of registration and the registrar is satisfied
              that the registrant has contravened a provision of this Act, the regulations or a term
              or condition of the registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the registrar is satisfied that a registrant has contravened a provision of
            this Act, the regulations or a term or condition of the registration, the registrar
            may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cancel the registration, or

suspend the registration for a period of time and subject to conditions the
              registrar considers necessary.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
hold a hearing before making a decision under subsection (1) or (2),
              and

provide the applicant or registrant written reasons for the
              decision.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar may appoint persons or persons within a class of persons as
            inspectors.

The registrar may impose restrictions on the powers and duties that an inspector
            may exercise under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
An inspector may conduct an inspection for the purpose of determining whether a
          person is in compliance with this Act, the regulations or the terms and conditions of the
          person's registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of an inspection, an inspector may, during normal business
            hours, do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: enter and inspect the premises of a metal dealer or recycler;

inspect, audit or examine any record, goods or other thing in the
              premises;

demand that a document or any other thing be produced for
              inspection;
remove a record or any other thing for review and copying;

remove and retain a record or any other thing that may be required as evidence
              from the premises;
question a person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a record or thing is removed under subsection (1) (d) or (e), the
            inspector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may make copies of, take extracts from or otherwise record the record or
              thing, and

must give a receipt to the person from whom the record or thing is
              taken.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The authority under subsection (1) must not be used to enter a private dwelling
            except with the consent of the occupant or under the authority of a warrant under
              section
              16.

The inspector, on request of a person whose premises the inspector enters, must
            present identification provided by the minister for this purpose.

If satisfied by evidence given under oath that entry on or into a building,
            receptacle or place, including a private dwelling, is necessary for any purpose related
            to conducting an inspection under this Act, a justice may issue a warrant authorizing an
            inspector to, during normal business hours, enter on or into that building, receptacle
            or place and conduct an inspection.

In the warrant, a justice may authorize an inspector to do one or both of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: enter at a specified time or within a specified period of time;
enter by force, if necessary.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An inspector may make an application for a warrant under subsection
              (1) without notice to any other person.

After giving a person an opportunity to be heard, the registrar may impose an
            administrative penalty on the person if the person contravenes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations, or
a term or condition of registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Before the registrar imposes an administrative penalty on a person, the
            registrar must consider the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
previous enforcement actions for contraventions of a similar nature by the
              person;
the gravity and magnitude of the contravention;
whether the contravention was repeated or continuous;
whether the contravention was deliberate;
any economic benefit derived by the person from the contravention;
the person's efforts to correct the contravention.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the registrar imposes an administrative penalty on a person, a prosecution
            for an offence under this Act for the same contravention may not be brought against the
            person.

A person who has been charged with an offence under this Act may not be subject
            to an administrative penalty in respect of the circumstances that gave rise to the
            charge.

If a business entity contravenes a prescribed provision of this Act or the
            regulations or a term or condition of a registration, an employee, officer, director or
            agent of the business entity who authorized, permitted or acquiesced in the
            contravention is also liable under this section, whether or not an administrative
            penalty is imposed on the business entity.

An individual on whom an administrative penalty is imposed is liable to a
            penalty of not more than $5 000.

A business entity on which an administrative penalty is imposed is liable to a
            penalty of not more than $50 000.

If the registrar imposes an administrative penalty on a person, the registrar
            must give to the person a notice imposing the administrative penalty that specifies the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention;
the amount of the penalty;
the date by which the penalty must be paid;
the person's right to have this decision reconsidered;
an address to which a request for a reconsideration may be given.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A notice imposing an administrative penalty may be reconsidered in accordance
            with section
              28.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The person on whom an administrative penalty is imposed must pay the
          administrative penalty

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
within 30 days after the date on which the person receives the notice referred
            to in section
              19 (1), or

within 30 days, if the person requests a reconsideration of the administrative
            penalty under section 28, after the date on which the person receives the notice
            referred to in section 28 (3) (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to a reconsideration of an administrative penalty or the expiry of the
            period of time within which a reconsideration may be requested, an administrative
            penalty constitutes a debt payable by the person on whom the penalty is
            imposed.

If a person fails to pay an administrative penalty as required under section 20,
            the registrar may file with the Supreme Court or Provincial Court a certified copy of
            the notice imposing the administrative penalty and, on being filed, the notice has the
            same force and effect, and all proceedings may be taken on the notice, as if the notice
            were a judgment of that court.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The registrar must pay all amounts derived from administrative penalties into the
          consolidated revenue fund.

The time limit for giving a notice imposing an administrative penalty is 2 years
          after the date on which the contravention occurred.

bcl:text:
On application by the registrar, the Supreme Court may grant an
            injunction

and, until disposition of the injunction proceeding, the court may grant an
            interim injunction.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
restraining a person or business entity from contravening this Act or the
              regulations if the court is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe
              that the person or business entity has contravened or is likely to contravene this Act
              or the regulations,

requiring a person or business entity to comply with this Act or the
              regulations if the court is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe
              that the person or business entity has not complied, or is not likely to comply, with
              this Act or the regulations, or

requiring a person or business entity not to hold themselves out as being
              registered if they are not registered under this Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An injunction regarding a contravention may be granted under subsection
              (1) whether or not a penalty or other remedy is provided by this Act for
            the contravention.

With respect to considering an interim injunction under subsection
              (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the court must give greater weight, importance and the balance of convenience
              to the enforcement of this Act than to the continued operation of the person or
              business entity,

the registrar must not be required to post a bond or give an undertaking as to
              damages, and

the registrar need not establish that irreparable harm will be done if the
              interim injunction is not issued.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
sections 2, 3, 5,
                6, 7 or 8;
subsection (4) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who provides false or misleading information in any of the following
            circumstances commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: when required or authorized under this Act to provide information;
when applying for registration under this Act;

when requested, ordered or directed by the registrar or an inspector to
              provide information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person does not commit an offence under subsection (2) if, at the time
            the information was supplied, the person did not know that the information was false or
            misleading and, with the exercise of reasonable diligence, could not have known that the
            information was false or misleading.

A person must not obstruct, impede or refuse to admit an inspector who is
            exercising powers or performing duties under this Act or a warrant issued under, or for
            the purposes of enforcing, this Act.

If a business entity commits an offence under this section, an employee,
            officer, director or agent of the business entity who authorized, permitted or
            acquiesced in the commission of the offence also commits an offence.

Subsection (5) applies whether or not the business entity is prosecuted
            for the offence.

bcl:text.#text:
Section
              5 of the  does not apply for the
            purposes of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An individual who commits an offence under section 25 is liable on
            conviction to a fine of not more than $10 000 or imprisonment for not longer than 6
            months, or both.

A business entity that commits an offence under section 25 is liable on
            conviction to a fine of not more than $100 000.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Registrar of Metal Dealers and Recyclers

bcl:text.#text:
The minister must appoint, under the , an individual as the Registrar of Metal Dealers and
            Recyclers.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar has the powers and duties conferred or imposed on the registrar
            under this Act.
A person may request the registrar to reconsider a decision under section 10 (2), 12 (1) or (2) or 19

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
within 30 days after receiving notice of or reasons for the decision,
              or

within the period of time specified by the registrar, if the registrar is
              satisfied that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
special circumstances existed which precluded the filing of a request for
                reconsideration within the period of time required in paragraph (a) of this
                subsection, and
an injustice would otherwise result.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person must make the request under subsection (1) in writing and
            must identify the error the person believes was made or the other grounds on which a
            reconsideration is requested.
On receiving a request under this section, the registrar must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: confirm, vary or cancel the decision, and

notify the person in writing of the registrar's decision under paragraph
                (a) and of the reasons for the decision.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The registrar may hold a hearing under this Act in writing, electronically or
          orally or by any combination of written, electronic or oral hearings.

This Act does not apply to a person who purchases or sells a used motor vehicle
          that has been, or will be, crushed for the purposes of recycling it.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the
              .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1) of this section, the Lieutenant
            Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing identification for the purposes of section 2 (a);
prescribing information for the purposes of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 2 (b) (ii),

section 5
                  (1) (b) (vi) and (2) (b) and (f), and
section 11 (a) (ii);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the manner in which customer codes are determined;

prescribing an entity for the purpose of section 3 (3) (b)
              (iii);

regulating or prohibiting cash transactions in relation to regulated
              metal;

respecting the manner and form in which transaction information must be
              recorded and maintained for the purpose of section 7.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1) of this section, the Lieutenant
            Governor in Council may make regulations respecting registration and renewal of
            registration under this Act, including, without limitation, the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing conditions or requirements that must be met by a person applying
              for registration or renewal of registration;

prescribing the information that a person applying for registration or renewal
              of registration is required to provide;
respecting forms of applications and registrations;
prescribing fees for the purpose of section 9 (2) (b);

prescribing a maximum period of time for the purpose of section 10
                (1);

prescribing terms and conditions of registration for the purpose of section 11
                (c).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1) of this section, the Lieutenant
            Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing a person or class of persons for the purpose of the definition of
              "business entity" in section 1;

prescribing a local body as a local authority for the purpose of the
              definition of "local authority" in section 1;

prescribing metals or alloys for the purpose of the definition of "non-ferrous
              metal" in section 1;

prescribing items or classes of items for the purpose of the definition of
              "regulated metal" in section 1;
defining terms that are used but not defined in this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1) of this section, the Lieutenant
            Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing provisions for the purpose of section 17 (1) (a);

establishing an offence for the contravention of a regulation and prescribing
              a penalty for that offence up to the maximum penalties set out in section
              26.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Section
            8 does not apply, for a period of 6 months after the date this section comes
          into force, to a person who, on that date, carries on business as a metal dealer or
          recycler.
